item.title: Bulletin updated at 18:02 HKT 17/08/2020
item.description:
At 6 p.m. at the Hong Kong Observatory :
Air temperature : 28 degrees Celsius
Relative Humidity : 85 per cent
During the past hour the mean UV Index recorded at King's Park : 0.6
Intensity of UV radiation : low

The area of low pressure near Luzon came within 800 kilometres of Hong Kong this afternoon. It remains loosely organised and maintains a distance from Hong Kong. It will not affect the local weather directly tonight. The area of low pressure will further develop into a tropical depression in the next couple of days, and edge closer to the vicinity of the coast of western Guangdong to Hainan Island gradually. According to the current forecast track, local winds will strengthen gradually later tomorrow (18th August). The Observatory will consider issuing the Standby Signal, No. 1 tomorrow morning. Under its influence, the weather will be windy with heavy squally showers and thunderstorms over Hong Kong in the next couple of days. There will be swells. The Observatory will closely monitor the impact of the area of low pressure on the local weather.
